page.title: 05Local History
page.content: Many sites of antiquity are noted on the Ordnance survey map. A British-Romano site on one field was excavated in the l950s and will be further investigated. There are three tumuli sites, old flint mines, enclosures and a settlement. A meadow behind the crematorium is recognised to be of Saxon archeological interest. The terrace, one small wall and the ice house are all that remain of the l360 Manor House, demolished in l960. The llth Century Findon Parish Church is constructed of local flint. The burial ground around the church is no longer used.
